metadata.synopsis: When you arrive on the rooftop after making Ketheric vulnerable, he will be shivering and furious at the fact that his invulnerability has been taken from him. The Tower is under attack and he's in a desperate state. He will fight the player, unless by a huge stroke of luck the player convinces him to surrender. Edge-case path: Audience with the Absolute (captured Nightsong then messed up Z'rell)
metadata.how_to_trigger: * oe unlockrooftop* oe mooassaultGo to the MOO rooftop and speak to Ketheric.

64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
64.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
64.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Ketheric; he is shivering; anxious; manic with the reality that he has been made vulnerable.

Ketheric jerkily turns toward the player with hatred in his eyes.InternalNodeContext: INTRO: Before initial fight

67.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
67.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
67.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Ketheric; he is shivering; anxious; manic with the reality that he has been made vulnerable.

Tremors shake the tower now and then, evidence of Nightsong's assault.
Ketheric jerkily turns toward the player with hatred in his eyes.InternalNodeContext: INTRO: Before initial fight

3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
3.text: You desecrate my halls. Kill my faithful. What heresy twists inside you?!
3.context: NodeContext: Furious; still with that slavering fury

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You're mortal again, Thorm. I've come to finish you.
18.context: NodeContext: Furious; still with that slavering fury

92.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
92.text: Impossible. You are a thrall - a slave!
92.context: NodeContext: Furious; still with that slavering fury

15.speaker: Player
15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

111.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
111.text: A pawn cannot lecture the Chosen of the gods.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: This is your end, General Thorm. Face me, and die with dignity.
51.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

57.text: How dare you interfere? You are like the digits of a hand - it is for you to act, not to decide.

CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. 59.text: You serve the Absolute. You. Serve. ME! Bow, you dog. BOW!
59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Surrender now, and I'll consider letting you live.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
44.text: You've come this far. You've stripped your enemy of his advantage. Why would you show mercy now?
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
79.text: You've come this far. You've stripped your enemy of his advantage. Why would you show mercy now?
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I'm not like you, Ketheric. My only interest is what is right.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
13.text: Who decides what is right? The gods did not care for right and wrong when they dismantled my life piece by piece.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

109.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
109.text: Who decides what is right? The gods did not care for right and wrong when they dismantled my life piece by piece.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
76.text: And when I tried to buy it back, it cost me everything - everything.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

58.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
58.text: We are copper pieces in their belts. Tokens to be traded for scraps.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

81.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
81.text: You have beaten me, True Soul. But the gods beat me first.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

102.text: And you will decide what is right?
102.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
1.text: You who have begged, stolen, killed - same as I - to make it to this tower?
1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)' InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

103.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
103.text: I think not, True soul. You serve the Absolute. You serve me. Bow, you dog. BOW!
103.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)' InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I may or I may not. But if you try to attack me, I will crush your skull.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

26.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
26.text: We're not so different, it seems. We both want what we want, and no opposition, no resistance will prevent us.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
66.text: We're not so different, it seems. We both want what we want, and no opposition, no resistance will prevent us.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

30.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
30.text: And yet... you have beaten me.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

31.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
31.text: It has taken a century of misfortune. A century of loss. A century of regret.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

52.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
52.text: And now... perhaps it is over.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

21.text: I can help you, Ketheric - if you let me.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to Ketheric but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I can help you, Ketheric - if you let me.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to Ketheric but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

6.speaker: Nightsong
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to Ketheric but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

71.speaker: Nightsong
71.text: Rise, you dog! Retribution has come, and her sword is my sword!
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

0.speaker: Player
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

116.speaker: Nightsong
116.text: Ha! Ketheric Thorm would sooner die than lay down his rank cause. Isn't that right, General?
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

40.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
40.text: I was a fool to hesitate. Power like mine cannot be hidden, cannot be cowed. But power like mine has a price. A price I am destined to pay.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

34.text: You have one last chance to bow. Once it's gone, I'll have no choice but to destroy you both. Do you hear?! BOW!

112.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
112.text: You have one last chance to bow. Once it's gone, I'll have no choice but to destroy you both. Do you hear?! BOW!

54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
54.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric looks over the balcony to the playerInternalNodeContext: NIGHTSONG

85.speaker: Nightsong
85.text: He will crumble at the power of your touch - give him all you have.
85.context: NodeContext: Ending big speech before combat

11.speaker: Nightsong
11.text: THE GODS FIGHT AT OUR SIDE!
11.context: NodeContext: Ending big speech before combat

70.speaker: Player
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
28.text: Your word's as good as mine, it seems. Very well.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

41.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
41.text: It was destined to come to this. The power I've accrued. The enemies I've cowed. Returned to me at last. Returned to me for the final time.

82.speaker: Player
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
10.text: Aylin. I was hoping you'd come.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

50.speaker: Nightsong
50.text: Ha! Ha! Free from your shackles; free from the pets you sicced on me for a hundred years. Do I frighten you, old man?

62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
62.text: Let us finish this, Aylin. I have a price to pay for my power. It will cost me your life - for my own, I have already paid.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: It isn't too late, Ketheric. Your story doesn't end here.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric  raises his head to look at us, but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

22.speaker: Nightsong
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric  raises his head to look at us, but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
9.text: I am the Chosen - the Chosen. Did you know that?
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric is on one knee, head down, and begins to rise when he suddenly stops short, as though hearing something.

108.text: I gave up everything. My family. My life. I cannot stop here. I must finish what I started. One way or another.
108.context: NodeContext: Mix of resolve and sadness here. He doesn't really want to finish what he started, but he knows it's too late now. Foreshadowing the fact that if you get this node, he will try to help you later (though he will fail)

83.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
83.text: I gave up everything. My family. My life. I cannot stop here. I must finish what I started. One way or another.
83.context: NodeContext: Mix of resolve and sadness here. He doesn't really want to finish what he started, but he knows it's too late now. Foreshadowing the fact that if you get this node, he will try to help you later (though he will fail)

16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
16.text: Do what I say. Prostrate yourself before me. For if you do not, your suffering will be worse.
16.context: NodeContext: He's trying to help us here; he almost stopped being evil but he can't give in yet.

20.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
20.text: It is better that you bow. Do you hear me? BOW!
20.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)' InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one. Can be a bit more of an extended yell

101.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: the player is knocked backward.

84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
84.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric stands up quickly, hatred in his eyes. Gestures to cast a big, scary looking necro spell aimed at the player. The player shields themselves, but at the moment where it seems Ketheric is about to launch a fatal blow, a flash of light appears, and Ketheric is pushed away and to the ground. Nightsong is standing in his place.InternalNodeContext: NIGHTSONG

97.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
97.context: CinematicNodeContext:  The player shields themselves, but at the moment where it seems Ketheric is about to launch a fatal blow, a flash of light appears, and Ketheric is pushed away and to the ground. Nightsong is standing in his place.NodeContext: to Nightsong

33.text: How good it is to see you again, Ketheric. At last you've found a god-master that suits you, it seems.
33.context: NodeContext: cold as ice - still talking to ketheric

75.speaker: Nightsong
75.text: How good it is to see you again, Ketheric. At last you've found a god-master that suits you, it seems.
75.context: NodeContext: cold as ice - still talking to ketheric

93.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
93.text: Aylin. The thief. You stole Isobel from me, and now you think you'll take my life in the bargain?
93.context: NodeContext: cold as ice - still talking to ketheric

80.speaker: Nightsong
80.text: You dare to speak her name? After your crimes innumerable, you would evoke her before me?
80.context: NodeContext: cold as ice - still talking to ketheric

55.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
55.text: Enough! This ends here and now - at last.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

49.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
49.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric begins combat wit hthe player.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Come quietly, and you'll be spared.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Seeing one's enemies cowed never gets old.

78.text: Listen to yourself. A mouse who fancies itself an eagle.

96.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
96.text: Listen to yourself. A mouse who fancies itself an eagle.

89.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
89.text: I will not be threatened by a thrall. A slave. A mere finger in the fist that will crush who and when I demand.
89.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

107.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
107.text: Bow before me - before the Absolute! BOW!
107.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

98.speaker: Player
98.text: A higher power wants you to live.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

69.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
69.text: It doesn't make sense. I - I don't understand.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

17.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
17.text: It doesn't make sense. I - I don't understand.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

37.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
37.text: I was given - I was told -
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
4.text: The gods... We are so little before them. So small.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

106.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
106.text: Haven't you figured it out by now, True Soul? I do not serve the Absolute. The Absolute serves me. Bow, you dog. BOW!
106.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

23.text: Live? You misunderstand me, True Soul. And it will be your undoing.
23.context: NodeContext: Live as in 'live and let live,' not live as in 'live from new york, it's saturday night'

74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
74.text: Live? You misunderstand me, True Soul. And it will be your undoing.
74.context: NodeContext: Live as in 'live and let live,' not live as in 'live from new york, it's saturday night'

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You've seen what I'm capable of. Surrender now, and I'll consider letting you live.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Melodia wanted more for you than this, Ketheric. Stop, and you may redeem yourself yet.

113.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
113.text: There is no redemption. Can't you see? It is too late.

104.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
104.text: There is no redemption. Can't you see? It is too late.

65.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
65.text: If Melodia could see all I've done, she'd know... she'd know her husband died long ago, with Isobel.

27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
27.text: Unlike Isobel, he could not be brought back.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You're wrong, Ketheric. It isn't too late for you.

91.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
91.text: I haven't forgotten her embrace. Melodia's. Nor Selûne's.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Melodia is waiting for you in the afterlife. Return to Selûne, and your souls will be reunited.

32.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
32.text: I wish it could be so. I do.

60.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
60.text: But the Moonmaiden did not intervene when my life was dismantled piece by piece.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: So you'll continue this spectacle of violence? To what end?

45.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
45.text: This is no spectacle. This is payment.

46.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
46.text: My life was dismantled piece by piece. First my wife was taken - my wife! And then my beautiful daughter. My life was forfeit. Gone. Finished.

56.text: You attempt to intrude upon my heart? To destroy me from within? No, True Soul. You forget yourself.

86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
86.text: You attempt to intrude upon my heart? To destroy me from within? No, True Soul. You forget yourself.
